name: the tiny pompom hat
notes:
my christmas gift to the knitting community and a favourite go-to hat, that matches my [rebellious scarf](/patterns/library/rebellious-scarf) 

* the pattern is written for five sizes
1 (2, 3, 4, 5) to fit both children and adults 
with a finished circumference of ca. 45 (49, 54, 59, 64) cm // 17.5 (19.5, 21.25, 23.25, 25) in. 

the sample is shown in size 3 on a model with 54 cm (21.25 in) head circumference. for more of the finished garment measurements, please refer to the schematic. 

**yarn**

* ca. 40 (55, 66, 76, 86) g or less than 1 skein 
of 100% irish wool from donegal spinning company, with ca. 200 m (218 yds) per 100 g skein, shown in colourway grey 3750;

* or ca. 80 (110, 132, 152, 172) m // 87 (120, 144, 166, 187) yds of any other worsted/light aran weight yarn with a matching gauge. 

***the yardage includes enough for a tiny (2.5 cm (1 in) in diameter) pompom.***

**needles and notions**
* 4 mm (us 6) circular needles with 40-60 cm (16-24 in) long cable (try a magic loop technique if using a longer cable needle); 
* a set of 4.0 mm (us 6) dpns (double pointed needles) for the crown (optional);
* one stitch marker;
* a tapestry needle or a crochet hook to finish and weave in the ends.

**gauge**

* 17 sts & 28 rnds in 10 cm (4 in) on 4.0 mm (us 6) needles measured over 2x2 ribbing in the round after blocking;

adjust the needle sizes if necessary to obtain the correct gauge.
